intro: Myrsine calcarata, commonly known as the rock myrsine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for birds. Myrsine calcarata typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
